content: my grandmother s slippers note the text of this pattern is based on what i remember from the pairs of slippers my grandmother made for us when we were children i have had so many requests for a written version of the design that i eventually captured it on paper to share with everyone who is interested skill level beginner/easy size adjustable children to adult materials about 150 yds each of 2 colors of worsted wt yarn color a and color b size us 8 5 mm needles or size needed to achieve gauge pompom maker tapestry needle gauge 7 sts = 2 6 row 3 ridges = 1 in garter st on size 8 needles slipper make 2 with 1 strand color a held together with 1 strand color b cast on 29 foot portion row 1 knit 9 purl 1 knit 9 purl 1 knit 9 row 2 knit across repeat these 2 row until garter stitch portion measures approx 3 -4 for children 6 -7 for adults ** 1 **clarification the total slipper length should end up being 1/2 less than total foot length in other words whatever combination of garter st portion & ribbed toe portion should come out to 1/2 less than total foot length for example for a 7 foot the garter st portion could be worked to 4 5 and then the ribbed toe portion for 2 which would equal 6 5 before finishing off the toe in my case i have a 9 foot so would work 6 of garter st and 2 5 of ribbing for a total length of 8 5 before finishing off the toe begin ribbed toe portion row 1 *knit 1 purl 1 repeat from * across row 2 knit the knit stitches and purl the purl stitches as they face you to form knit 1 purl 1 ribbing repeat last row until ribbed portion measures approx 1 -2 for children 2 -3 for adults or until measurement of slipper from beginning is 1/2 less than total foot length see clarification note above on last row of ribbing decrease one stitch so there are 28 stitches remaining for pointy-toe version decrease for toe *knit 2 together repeat from * across 14 next row purl across 14 next row *knit 2 together repeat from * across 7 next row purl across 7 for round-toe version decrease for toe *knit 2 together repeat from * across 14 cut yarn leaving tail long enough for sewing toe seam gather remaining stitches together by running yarn through stitches on needle and pulling tight to close toe then sew toe seam until you reach the garter stitch portion finish off and weave in ends with separate length of yarn sew up heel seam if desired make 2 large fluffy pompoms using both color a and color b together and attach to top of slipper copyright 2017 2012 kathy north www ravelry com/designers/kathy-north for personal or charity use only do not duplicate pattern
